result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Email communication only with H.S. and only if that communication relates to Sauk Co. case 16 SC 147

Defendant Joshua J. McCoy not in court.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances.  Court notes DE filed motion for bond modification.  State states their position.  Wishes DE would have been here to be reminded of the limited reason the contact would be allowed.  Court modifies condition #7 to allow EMAIL COMMUNICATION ONLY w/H.S. and only if that communication relates to Sauk County case number 16SC1024.  Court notes this modification applies to 16CM147 ONLY and not to any other matters that may be pending.

Defendant Joshua J. McCoy in court with attorney Phillip Stamman.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives agreement reached.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of const. rights, plea accepted by Ct.  Ct. withholds adj. of guilt. Attorney Samman gives statement.  Deferred Prosecution Ordered 18 mo. on Ct. 1; Filed agreement today.  Count 2 Dismissed/read in.  Review scheduled for March 2, 2018.

Defendant Joshua J. McCoy in court with attorney Phillip Stamman.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victims petition for bond modification. Victim HS appears by phone.  Motion to have contact w/children not with H.S.  Atty. Ryan makes statement opposing motion, matter for family court.  Atty. Stamen makes statement remove a no contact in place to have family court way the options of custody/visitation.  Victim lives in Utah now.  969.09(4) allows for intimidation of witness.  Children were not being or threatened to be harmed.  HS makes statement.  Court grants motion.  Court modifies bond condition to - to remove no contact w/children.
